title: The Nest Of Vice
opening: All that remains is Olbern Keep, where General Lang remains barricaded. Lang used his influence to steal belongings, daughters, and lives from the people of Grust. Was there ever a man as cruel as he is?
"I cannot forgive him. I shall take him down without fail!" Prince Marth raised his sword to the skies and ordered firmly: "Altean knights, charge!!"

intro.speaker: Jagen
intro.line: Kris, you should be aware that Lang is a general with high defense. To defeat him, you would do well to attack with magic or a special weapon like an armorslayer.

intro.speaker: Jagen
intro.line: If you plan to defeat him with strength alone, you'd have to be extremely powerful.

intro.speaker: Jagen
intro.line: Kris, your strength is simply tremendous. Against a blow from you, Lang's armor would crumple like paper. Please, in my stead, kill that insolent man.

intro.speaker: Jagen
intro.line: Kris, your strength is quite impressive. You might just be able to defeat Lang. Please, in my stead, kill that insolent man.

intro.speaker: Jagen
intro.line: Kris, you are, sadly, not very strong. But you could fight using your other talents. Please, in my stead, kill that insolent man.

intro.speaker: Lang
intro.line: Heh heh heh... So the Alteans have come. Reinforcements are arriving soon; if we can hold out a little longer, we can make a pincer attack. Swordsman Navarre. When they open that door, you make your move. There is no need for restraint; slice them to pieces!

intro.speaker: Navarre
intro.line: Yeah... sure. Though the knights of Altea are hardly worthy enemies.

intro.speaker: Lang
intro.line: Oh-ho! That's my Navarre. They say not even Ogma of Talys is your equal.

intro.speaker: Navarre
intro.line: What? Ogma?! N... Naturally... A guy like him is no match for me.

intro.speaker: Lang
intro.line: I see. Glad to hear it. Then I'll leave this place in your capable hands, Navarre!

battle.speaker: Jagen
battle.line: Sire, there seems to be movement near the front of the castle. And it would appear to be moving towards our forces.

battle.speaker: Marth
battle.line: Are they enemy reinforcements? Or allies to our cause...?

battle.speaker: Jagen
battle.line: I do not know, but... I do hope they are allies.

battle.speaker: Frey
battle.line: You too, sire. Norne and I escaped from Altea Castle and we rode here as fast as we could.

battle.speaker: Norne
battle.line: But the rest of our forces were scattered... I'm sorry we couldn't all make it.

battle.speaker: Marth
battle.line: You don't have to apologize, I'm just glad that you're safe. The others can take care of themselves.

battle.speaker: Frey
battle.line: Sire. From here on we shall accompany you. Please give us your orders.

battle.speaker: Norne
battle.line: Oh, and please be careful! I caught a glimpse of enemy troops approachin' the castle behind us. I expect they'll be enterin' the castle soon.

battle.speaker: Marth
battle.line: Enemy reinforcements? I understand. Thank you.

recruit-talk.speaker: Caeda
recruit-talk.line: Navarre, please hear me out! Lend your sword to our case, just once more!

recruit-talk.speaker: Navarre
recruit-talk.line: What? Who are you? I'll have no business with women or children... But, there's a first for everything... (Whoa, she's smoking!) What business do you have with me?

recruit-talk.speaker: Caeda
recruit-talk.line: ...... Y-you're not Navarre! Who are you?

recruit-talk.speaker: Samuel
recruit-talk.line: Yikes, I've been exposed, huh? I'm actually a stingy mercenary known as Samuel. Somehow, I keep getting mistaken for this famous "Navarre" swordsman guy. I got tired of it after a while, so I decided to pose as him and got myself hired. But I don't like this General Lang guy either. If you're alright with it, I'll lend you my sword.

recruit-talk.speaker: Navarre
recruit-talk.line: Stay away... This evening, my killing edge hungers for blood...

recruit-talk.speaker: Ogma
recruit-talk.line: Do you mean to kill me, no matter what? Hmph, very well. I knew that we'd have to settle our score eventually.

recruit-talk.speaker: Samuel
recruit-talk.line: Wait... Stay your blade! ...I'm no Navarre, I'm just a sham. I... it's me, Samuel. Have you forgotten, Ogma?

recruit-talk.speaker: Ogma
recruit-talk.line: Samuel?! Samuel, the gladiator from Knorda?

recruit-talk.speaker: Samuel
recruit-talk.line: Yes, I was a slave gladiator at the time, and you really helped me out. Even when everyone was making their escape, you stayed behind to distract the guards and ended up caught...

recruit-talk.speaker: Samuel
recruit-talk.line: I heard everything from my friends. How you were dragged out to the square and whipped until you looked like a corpse. How, by chance, the young Princess Talys, tears in her eyes, stood up for you and saved you. And that's why you swore your blade to Talys. Or rather... to the princess...

recruit-talk.speaker: Ogma
recruit-talk.line: Enough... Say no more! No more. It's in the past now... No more...

recruit-talk.speaker: Samuel
recruit-talk.line: ...Ogma... Anyway, I want to repay you! I'm following you from now on, okay?

recruit-battle.speaker: Navarre
recruit-battle.line: I pity your soul. But I can at least grant you a quick death. Take this! My killing edge!!

recruit-battle.speaker: Samuel
recruit-battle.line: Doh, I shouldn't have said that I was Navarre...

boss.speaker: Lang
boss.line: W-wait, please! I'm sorry... Please forgive me... I've only done as the Emperor ordered me to. I didn't agree with him, but I had no choice. So... so please, s-spare my life... I'll do anything you say. Yes... Just like this... Mwahaha! You shouldn't have let your guard down! You fool... Now die!

boss.speaker: Lang
boss.line: Urgh... Impossible... I have been defeated...

boss.speaker: Marth
boss.line: General Lang, I have--with my own eyes--witnessed a number of your crimes. I cannot forgive you. But if you have something to say, I will listen.

boss.speaker: Lang
boss.line: S-silence... silence! You damned country-boy prince! You're a fool for coming here! Just die already!

boss.speaker: Marth
boss.line: Is that your answer? Then prepare yourself!

boss.speaker: Lang
boss.line: Y-you! You're that impertinent little girl/boy from before...!

boss.speaker: Kris
boss.line: Lang! You have oppressed countless people, and insulted my liege. You can only atone for these sins with your life!

end.speaker: Marth
end.line: Lord Wendell! Thank goodness you're unharmed.

end.speaker: Wendell
end.line: Lang accused me of collaborating with the rebels and had me imprisoned. Even though I told him that I must fulfill a mission assigned to me by Archsage Gotoh...

end.speaker: Marth
end.line: A mission from Lord Gotoh?

end.speaker: Wendell
end.line: That's correct... You have seen the "Starsphere"--the holy orb with the twelve constellations etched on its surface. In order to pierce Gharnef's shadowy veil, Lord Gotoh created a sacred spell named "Starlight" from that orb.

end.speaker: Wendell
end.line: Unfortunately, the strain on the Starsphere was so severe that it shattered into twelve shards, which scattered into the sky. Lord Gotoh told me that this world has long been guarded by five orbs of mysterious arcane power, and that if even one of them is lost, the world will fall into irreparable ruin. By any means possible, we must gather the twelve star shards and restore the Starsphere.

end.speaker: Marth
end.line: Is... Is this a joke? That the world could just end... This is all very hard to take in. But aren't these the star shards? If so, we already have a few. After we retake Altea, we'd be glad to help you find the remaining shards and orbs.

end.speaker: Wendell
end.line: Of course... Your country was only just invaded by the Empire... I understand, Prince... I too shall fight to restore Altea, then. Thinking about it, my meeting with you is like a sign from Lord Gotoh himself. In that case, I shall surrender myself to fate. But, please, let's stop by the Fane of Raman. We may be able to find some star shards in the ancient temple.

end.speaker: Marth
end.line: Understood. If it's the Fane of Raman, we can go there on our way to Altea!

end.speaker: Marth
end.line: General Lang has been defeated. And now the people of Grust no longer have to suffer.

end.speaker: Kris
end.line: That's right, sire.

end.speaker: Marth
end.line: Kris, since leaving Altea, we've had a great deal of fights... Looking back at them now...

end.speaker: Marth
end.line: None of our companions were hurt and none of them died. That's what I'm happiest about. Kris, it's because you've been here. Thank you so much.

end.speaker: Marth
end.line: It couldn't be helped, but... Some of our comrades were injured or passed on. I don't want to lose anyone from now. I know we can do it if you're there. Kris, please, help me.

end.speaker: Marth
end.line: All I remember is seeing our companions fall, one by one... Enough! I don't want any of our comrades to suffer that pain. Kris, please, help me.

end.speaker: Jagen
end.line: Sire, some new information has come in from the patrol. Just ahead, the enemy seems to be preparing some kind of ambush. It's not the Archanean Empire, but likely, I fear, mercenaries hired with coin.

end.speaker: Marth
end.line: Mercenaries, is it...? Do we continue as we are or take a longer, safer route? Personally, I'd rather not detour. We have to return to Altea as soon as possible.

end.speaker: Jagen
end.line: Hmph, if you would allow me to speak as your tactician... I think we ought to stay here and fight. We will be facing mercenaries. The Altean knights would never lose to mere mercenaries.

end.speaker: Marth
end.line: Kris, your thoughts?

end.speaker: Kris
end.line: I agree with Sir Jagen.

end.speaker: Marth
end.line: I see, thank you. Jagen, Kris! The whole army shall move on as they were. We'll hit the mercenaries head-on!
